questions.question: Is Hannay enjoying London when we first meet him?

choices.answer: Yes, he thinks it is wonderful.
No not at all.
It has disappointed him from the first.
Yes, but he is bored of it now.

questions.question: Where abouts is Hannay from?

choices.answer: South Africa
Zimbabwe
Swaziland
Mozambique

questions.question: I happen at this moment to be dead. Who said this?

choices.answer: Hannay to Scudder
Shudder to Paddock
Paddock to Hannay
Scudder to Hannay

questions.question: The plot Scudder had uncovered was aiming to:

choices.answer: Kill Constantine Kalorides
Start a war in Europe
Put Russia and Germany at loggerheads
All of the above

questions.question: Scudder disguises himself as

choices.answer: Captain Theophilus Digby
Admiral J.T. Pannet
Major Theodore Delahunt
Corporal Ian Smith

questions.question: In the book, how does Scudder die?

choices.answer: He is shot by a German spy
He falls out an open window
He is stabbed in the heart.
All of the above

questions.question: When Hannay finds Scudder dead in his apartment, what does he do?

choices.answer: Worry that he could be accused of murder.
Have a cup of tea with brandy in it.
Faint.
Fear for his life.

questions.question: Why does Hannay decide to go to Scotland?

choices.answer: He has a Scottish fiance√©.
Scotland is the best place for spies to go.
He has always wanted to visit.
He has Scottish heritage.

questions.question: Where does Hannay find Scudder's notebook containing the code?

choices.answer: In Scudder's pocket.
In his tobacco box.
Under the mattress in his spare room.
Inside an atlas.

questions.question: Who is the author of The 39 Steps?

choices.answer: John Buchan
John Bantam
John Balfour
John Snow

questions.question: Why does Hannay think that he can solve Scudder's code?

choices.answer: He has a good head for puzzles.
He had done some intelligence work during the Boer War.
It was a subject he was keen on.
All of the above.

questions.question: Why would it be unusual for Hannay to see an aeroplane in the Scottish Highlands?

choices.answer: People in Scotland didn't know how to fly.
Powered flight only started in 1903.
Aeroplanes had not been invented in the era the book is set.
Mountain air makes flying very difficult.

questions.question: Why is Julia important?

choices.answer: She betrays Hannay to the police.
She is the key to unlocking the cipher.
She is someone Hannay can trust.
She assists Hannay with an escape attempt.

questions.question: Hannah's speech is described as having "the eloquence of an emigration agent." This implies:

choices.answer: Emigration agents are good public speakers.
Hannay is a bad public speaker.
Emigration agents' speeches are not worth listening to.
Hannah used long words during his speech.

questions.question: Why does Hannay trust Sir Harry with Scudder's information?

choices.answer: Sir Harry has family in Government.
Sir Harry is mentioned in Scudder's notebook.
He mentions information written in the notebook.
He shares the same political views.

questions.question: Hannay describes Marmaduke Jopley as "an offence to creation." How is he useful?

choices.answer: He shares his lunch with Hannay.
He provides another disguise for Hannay.
He has vital new information about the plans for June 15th.
He is so scared of being murdered he will do anything.

questions.question: Hannay says his "lack of local knowledge could be his undoing." What immediately happens after?

choices.answer: He seeks shelter in the house of an enemy.
He falls in to a swamp.
He breaks his leg.
He is captured by the police.

questions.question: Hannay attributes his resourcefulness to what?

choices.answer: His previous job a a mining engineer.
His intelligence.
His ability to think quickly.
All of the above.

questions.question: What prompts Sir Walter to completely believe Scudder's story?

choices.answer: Hannay's ability to break the cipher.
A letter from the Prime Minister.
A phonecall confirming the death of Kalorides.
Hannay is an old friend of his.

questions.question: How does Alloa steal the top secret military documents?

choices.answer: He is given a copy by the War Secretary.
He has a photographic memory.
He has a servant break in to Sir Walter's house.
He copies them after a late night meeting.
